slowcontrol/temperature_probe/frontend.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         frontend.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     Example Slow Control Frontend program. Defines two
00007                 slow control equipments, one for a HV device and one
00008                 for a multimeter (usually a general purpose PC plug-in
00009                 card with A/D inputs/outputs. As a device driver,
00010                 the "null" driver is used which simulates a device
00011                 without accessing any hardware. The used class drivers
00012                 cd_hv and cd_multi act as a link between the ODB and
00013                 the equipment and contain some functionality like
00014                 ramping etc. To form a fully functional frontend,
00015                 the device driver "null" has to be replaces with
00016                 real device drivers.
00017 
00018 
00019   $Log: frontend.c,v $
00020   Revision 1.1.1.1  2004/10/20 18:41:18  admin
00021   Trying again to import midas-1.9.5.  There are NT executables, but I'm importing them as well (w/o -kb switch so watch out!)

00082 /* The frontend name (client name) as seen by other MIDAS clients   */
00083 char *frontend_name = "TemperatureMonitor";
00084 /* The frontend file name, don't change it */
00085 char *frontend_file_name = __FILE__;
00086 
00087 /* frontend_loop is called periodically if this variable is TRUE    */
00088 BOOL frontend_call_loop = TRUE;
00089 
00090 /* a frontend status page is displayed with this frequency in ms    */
00091 INT display_period = 1000;
00092 
00093 /* maximum event size produced by this frontend */
00094 INT max_event_size = 10000;
00095 
00096 /* maximum event size for fragmented events (EQ_FRAGMENTED) */
00097 INT max_event_size_frag = 5 * 1024 * 1024;
00098 
00099 /* buffer size to hold events */

00104 BANK_LIST temperature_bank_list[] = {

00106   { "" },
00107 };
00108 
00109 #undef USE_INT
00110 
00111 EQUIPMENT equipment[] = {
00112    {"TemperatureMonitor",            /* equipment name */
00113      { 23, 0,                       /* event ID, trigger mask */
00114        "SYSTEM",                   /* event buffer */
00115        EQ_PERIODIC,                  /* equipment type */
00116        0,                          /* event source */
00117        "MIDAS",                    /* format */
00118        TRUE,                       /* enabled */
00119        RO_ALWAYS|RO_ODB,           /* read all the time */
00120        10000,                      /* reads spaced by this many ms */
00121        0,                          /* stop run after this event limit */
00122        0,                          /* number of sub events */
00123        0,                          /* log history every event */
00124        "", "", "", },
00125     read_temperature_probe,              /* readout routine */
00126     NULL, NULL, 
00127     temperature_bank_list,
00128    },
00129

00159 /*-- Frontend Init -------------------------------------------------*/
00160 
00161 INT frontend_init()
00162 {
00163 
00164   // get the LabView filename
00165   cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
00166   
00167   if(db_find_key(hDB, 0, Alarm, &hKey) != SUCCESS){
00168     db_create_key(hDB,0,Alarm,TID_INT);
00169   }
00170 
00171   return CM_SUCCESS;
00172 }
00173 
00174 /*-- Frontend Exit -------------------------------------------------*/
00175 
00176 INT frontend_exit()
00177 {
00178   return CM_SUCCESS;
00179 }
00180 
00181 /*-- Frontend Loop -------------------------------------------------*/
00182 
00183 INT frontend_loop()
00184 {
00185    ss_sleep(100);
00186    return CM_SUCCESS;
00187 }
00188
